meanings.definition: The act of being a customer or supporter of a business or organization.
meanings.sent1: Her patronization of the local bookstore helped it stay in business.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the patronization of my favorite coffee shop every morning.
meanings.sent3: His patronization of the ice cream truck made him the neighborhood hero.
meanings.sent4: The patronization of the charity event was overwhelming, showing great community support.
meanings.sent5: The patronization of the art gallery brought life and color to the town.

meanings.definition: The act of treating someone in a condescending manner.
meanings.sent1: Her patronization towards the new employee was uncalled for.
meanings.sent2: I felt offended by his patronization during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat's patronization of the dog was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His patronization was like a dark cloud overshadowing the team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patronization of the students hindered their learning progress.

meanings.definition: The act of providing financial or other support to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Their patronization of the local shelter helped many animals find homes.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your patronization of my small business.
meanings.sent3: The tree's patronization of the vine allowed it to grow and flourish.
meanings.sent4: Her patronization of the struggling artist boosted his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The company's patronization of the event made it a huge success.
